AAPL.reasoning: Among four analysts, two (fundamentals and valuation) are bearish with 75% confidence each, while technical and sentiment analysts are neutral at 65% and 75% confidence respectively. The bearish signals carry stronger conviction and outnumber the neutral ones. Risk assessment indicates medium risk with normal volatility, which doesn't override the bearish fundamental and valuation consensus. Therefore, the decision leans bearish (short) with moderate-high confidence, weighted toward the higher-confidence bearish views.

MSFT.reasoning: Three out of four analysts (fundamentals, valuation, sentiment) are bearish with confidence levels of 75%, 85%, and 75% respectively, while only the technical analyst is neutral at 65%. The valuation analyst’s high confidence (85%) strongly reinforces the bearish stance. Risk remains medium with normal volatility, posing no contraindication. The overwhelming bearish consensus among analysts with above-average confidence justifies a short position with high confidence.
